Mitigative Measures and Observations in: During the 2009 PCEM, subsidence was observed • from KP 3.3 to KP 3.8.
Recommendations: Repair and continue monitoring for trench subsidence and for excessive crown loss causing altered drainage patterns and recontour where necessary.

Mitigative Measures and Observations in: •  Wetlands are naturally regenerating following construction. During the 2009 PCEM, low-lying areas along the • right-of-way were observed to be consistent with preconstruction drainage contours.

Environmental Issues: (a) Loss or alteration of native vegetation and vegetation important to wildlife
Mitigative Measures and Observations in: Areas of poor growth were noted from KP 0.0 to • KP 1.6 along the pipeline route during the 2009 PCEM; however, vegetation establishment generally <s>appears successful along the right-of-way.</s>
Recommendations: Broadcast seed with an approved native seed mix from KP 0.0 to KP 1.6. Continue monitoring the establishment of native vegetation.  Control trees and shrubs, if necessary, to facilitate pipeline surveillance, by mechanical rather than chemical means.

Mitigative Measures and Observations in: No weeds of concern were identified during the 2009 • <s>PCEM program.</s>
Recommendations: Continue monitoring for weed growth and introduction.

Environmental Issues: (a) Loss or alteration of potential wildlife habitat
